body:
# Gemini.cr

Google Gemini API written in Crystal.

It is not complete, it was created for use in another project, but it may be usable.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     gemini:
       github: joseafga/gemini.cr
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "gemini"

Gemini.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = "GEMINI_API_KEY"
end

model = Gemini::GenerativeModel.new("gemini-1.5-flash")
response = model.generate_content("Explain how AI works")

puts response.text
```

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/joseafga/gemini.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Jos√© Almeida](https://github.com/joseafga) - creator and maintainer

types.name: Gemini
types.doc:
Google Gemini API

```
require "gemini"

Gemini.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = "GEMINI_API_KEY"
end

model = Gemini::GenerativeModel.new("gemini-1.5-flash")
response = model.generate_content("Explain how AI works")

puts response.text
```
types.summary: Google Gemini API

class_methods.name: configure
class_methods.doc:
Customize settings using a block.

```
Gemini.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = "123asd"
end
```

def.name: try_parse_error
def.body:
begin
  @error = Error.from_json(response, root: "error")
  true
rescue
  false
end

types.name: GenerateContentResponse
types.doc:
Response from the model supporting multiple candidate responses.

[API Reference](https://ai.google.dev/api/generate-content#generatecontentresponse)
types.summary: Response from the model supporting multiple candidate responses.

instance_methods.doc: Candidate responses from the model.
instance_methods.summary: Candidate responses from the model.

instance_methods.name: parts
instance_methods.doc: A quick accessor equivalent to `#candidates.first.content!.parts`
instance_methods.summary: A quick accessor equivalent to #candidates.first.content!.parts

instance_methods.doc: Returns the prompt's feedback related to the content filters.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the prompt's feedback related to the content filters.

instance_methods.name: text
instance_methods.doc: A quick accessor equivalent to `#candidates.first.content!.parts.first.text`
instance_methods.summary: A quick accessor equivalent to #candidates.first.content!.parts.first.text

def.name: text
def.body:
io = IO::Memory.new
parts.each(&.text? do |text|
  (io << text) << '\n'
end)
io.to_s.chomp

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc: Alias for `#text`
instance_methods.summary: Alias for #text

instance_methods.summary: Metadata on the generation requests' token usage.

types.name: Candidate
types.doc:
A response candidate generated from the model.

[API Reference](https://ai.google.dev/api/generate-content#candidate)
types.summary: A response candidate generated from the model.

def.name: after_initialize
def.body:
if @content.nil?
  raise(MissingContentException.new("Field `#content` is missing", finish_reason))
end

instance_methods.name: content
instance_methods.doc: Generated content returned from the model. *(Output only)*
instance_methods.summary: Generated content returned from the model.

def.name: content
def.body:
if (value = @content).nil?
  ::raise(::NilAssertionError.new("Gemini::GenerateContentResponse::Candidate#content cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

The reason why the model stopped generating tokens. *(Optional, Output only)*
If empty, the model has not stopped generating tokens.

List of ratings for the safety of a response candidate.
There is at most one rating per category.

instance_methods.summary: Token count for this candidate.

instance_methods.summary: Number of tokens in the cached part of the prompt (the cached content)

instance_methods.name: candidates_token_count
instance_methods.doc: Total number of tokens across all the generated response candidates.
instance_methods.summary: Total number of tokens across all the generated response candidates.

instance_methods.name: prompt_token_count
instance_methods.doc:
Number of tokens in the prompt. When cachedContent is set, this is still the total effective prompt size meaning
this includes the number of tokens in the cached content.
instance_methods.summary: Number of tokens in the prompt.

instance_methods.name: total_token_count
instance_methods.doc: Total token count for the generation request (prompt + response candidates).
instance_methods.summary: Total token count for the generation request (prompt + response candidates).

Configuration options for model generation and outputs.
Not all parameters are configurable for every model.

[API Reference](https://ai.google.dev/api/generate-content#generationconfig)
types.summary: Configuration options for model generation and outputs.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (candidate_count : Int32 | Nil = nil, stop_sequences : Nil | Array(String) = nil, temperature : Float64 | Nil = nil, max_output_tokens : Int32 | Nil = nil, top_k : Int32 | Nil = nil, top_p : Float64 | Nil = nil, response_mime_type : Nil | String = nil, response_schema : Nil | Gemini::Schema = nil, presence_penalty : Float64 | Nil = nil, frequency_penalty : Float64 | Nil = nil, response_logprobs : Bool | Nil = nil, logprobs : Int32 | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (candidate_count : Int32 | Nil = nil, stop_sequences : Nil | Array(String) = nil, temperature : Float64 | Nil = nil, max_output_tokens : Int32 | Nil = nil, top_k : Int32 | Nil = nil, top_p : Float64 | Nil = nil, response_mime_type : Nil | String = nil, response_schema : Nil | Gemini::Schema = nil, presence_penalty : Float64 | Nil = nil, frequency_penalty : Float64 | Nil = nil, response_logprobs : Bool | Nil = nil, logprobs : Int32 | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(candidate_count, stop_sequences, temperature, max_output_tokens, top_k, top_p, response_mime_type, response_schema, presence_penalty, frequency_penalty, response_logprobs, logprobs)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: candidate_count
instance_methods.doc: Number of generated responses to return.
instance_methods.summary: Number of generated responses to return.

instance_methods.name: candidate_count=
instance_methods.doc: Number of generated responses to return.
instance_methods.summary: Number of generated responses to return.

instance_methods.name: frequency_penalty
instance_methods.doc:
Frequency penalty applied to the next token's logprobs, multiplied by the number of times each token has
been seen in the response so far. *(Optional)*
A positive penalty will discourage the use of tokens that have already been used, proportional to the number of
times the token has been used: The more a token is used, the more dificult it is for the model to use that token
again increasing the vocabulary of responses.

Caution: A negative penalty will encourage the model to reuse tokens proportional to the number of times the
token has been used. Small negative values will reduce the vocabulary of a response. Larger negative values will
cause the model to start repeating a common token until it hits the maxOutputTokens limit: "...the the the the
the...".
instance_methods.summary: Frequency penalty applied to the next token's logprobs, multiplied by the number of times each token has been seen in the response so far.

instance_methods.name: frequency_penalty=
instance_methods.doc:
Frequency penalty applied to the next token's logprobs, multiplied by the number of times each token has
been seen in the response so far. *(Optional)*
A positive penalty will discourage the use of tokens that have already been used, proportional to the number of
times the token has been used: The more a token is used, the more dificult it is for the model to use that token
again increasing the vocabulary of responses.

Caution: A negative penalty will encourage the model to reuse tokens proportional to the number of times the
token has been used. Small negative values will reduce the vocabulary of a response. Larger negative values will
cause the model to start repeating a common token until it hits the maxOutputTokens limit: "...the the the the
the...".
instance_methods.summary: Frequency penalty applied to the next token's logprobs, multiplied by the number of times each token has been seen in the response so far.

instance_methods.name: logprobs
instance_methods.doc:
Only valid if `#responseLogprobs` is `true`. This sets the number of top logprobs to return at each decoding
step in the `Candidate#logprobs_result`. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: Only valid if #responseLogprobs is true.

instance_methods.name: logprobs=
instance_methods.doc:
Only valid if `#responseLogprobs` is `true`. This sets the number of top logprobs to return at each decoding
step in the `Candidate#logprobs_result`. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: Only valid if #responseLogprobs is true.

instance_methods.name: max_output_tokens
instance_methods.doc:
The maximum number of tokens to include in a candidate.
If unset, this will default to output_token_limit specified in the model's specification.
instance_methods.summary: The maximum number of tokens to include in a candidate.

instance_methods.name: max_output_tokens=
instance_methods.doc:
The maximum number of tokens to include in a candidate.
If unset, this will default to output_token_limit specified in the model's specification.
instance_methods.summary: The maximum number of tokens to include in a candidate.

instance_methods.name: presence_penalty
instance_methods.doc:
Presence penalty applied to the next token's logprobs if the token has already been seen in the response.
*(Optional)*
This penalty is binary on/off and not dependant on the number of times the token is used (after the first).
Use frequencyPenalty for a penalty that increases with each use.
A positive penalty will discourage the use of tokens that have already been used in the response, increasing the
vocabulary.
A negative penalty will encourage the use of tokens that have already been used in the response, decreasing the
vocabulary.
instance_methods.summary: Presence penalty applied to the next token's logprobs if the token has already been seen in the response.

instance_methods.name: presence_penalty=
instance_methods.doc:
Presence penalty applied to the next token's logprobs if the token has already been seen in the response.
*(Optional)*
This penalty is binary on/off and not dependant on the number of times the token is used (after the first).
Use frequencyPenalty for a penalty that increases with each use.
A positive penalty will discourage the use of tokens that have already been used in the response, increasing the
vocabulary.
A negative penalty will encourage the use of tokens that have already been used in the response, decreasing the
vocabulary.
instance_methods.summary: Presence penalty applied to the next token's logprobs if the token has already been seen in the response.

instance_methods.name: response_logprobs=
instance_methods.doc: If `true`, export the logprobs results in response. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: If true, export the logprobs results in response.

instance_methods.name: response_logprobs?
instance_methods.doc: If `true`, export the logprobs results in response. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: If true, export the logprobs results in response.

instance_methods.name: response_mime_type
instance_methods.doc:
Output response mimetype of the generated candidate text.
Supported mimetype:
* **text/plain**: (default) Text output.
* **application/json**: JSON response in the candidates.
instance_methods.summary: Output response mimetype of the generated candidate text.

instance_methods.name: response_mime_type=
instance_methods.doc:
Output response mimetype of the generated candidate text.
Supported mimetype:
* **text/plain**: (default) Text output.
* **application/json**: JSON response in the candidates.
instance_methods.summary: Output response mimetype of the generated candidate text.

instance_methods.name: response_schema
instance_methods.doc: Specifies the format of the JSON requested if response_mime_type is `application/json`.
instance_methods.summary: Specifies the format of the JSON requested if response_mime_type is application/json.

instance_methods.name: response_schema=
instance_methods.doc: Specifies the format of the JSON requested if response_mime_type is `application/json`.
instance_methods.summary: Specifies the format of the JSON requested if response_mime_type is application/json.

instance_methods.name: stop_sequences
instance_methods.doc:
The set of character sequences (up to 5) that will stop output generation.
If specified, the API will stop at the first appearance of a stop sequence. The stop sequence will not be
included as part of the response.
instance_methods.summary: The set of character sequences (up to 5) that will stop output generation.

instance_methods.name: stop_sequences=
instance_methods.doc:
The set of character sequences (up to 5) that will stop output generation.
If specified, the API will stop at the first appearance of a stop sequence. The stop sequence will not be
included as part of the response.
instance_methods.summary: The set of character sequences (up to 5) that will stop output generation.

instance_methods.name: temperature
instance_methods.doc:
Controls the randomness of the output.
Values can range from `[0.0,1.0]`, inclusive. A value closer to `1.0` will produce responses that are more
varied and creative, while a value closer to `0.0` will typically result in more straightforward responses from
the model.
instance_methods.summary: Controls the randomness of the output.

instance_methods.name: temperature=
instance_methods.doc:
Controls the randomness of the output.
Values can range from `[0.0,1.0]`, inclusive. A value closer to `1.0` will produce responses that are more
varied and creative, while a value closer to `0.0` will typically result in more straightforward responses from
the model.
instance_methods.summary: Controls the randomness of the output.

instance_methods.name: top_k
instance_methods.doc:
The maximum number of tokens to consider when sampling.
The model uses combined Top-k and nucleus sampling. Top-k sampling considers the set of top_k most probable
tokens. Defaults to 40.
instance_methods.summary: The maximum number of tokens to consider when sampling.

instance_methods.name: top_k=
instance_methods.doc:
The maximum number of tokens to consider when sampling.
The model uses combined Top-k and nucleus sampling. Top-k sampling considers the set of top_k most probable
tokens. Defaults to 40.
instance_methods.summary: The maximum number of tokens to consider when sampling.

instance_methods.name: top_p
instance_methods.doc:
The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling.
The model uses combined Top-k and nucleus sampling.
Tokens are sorted based on their assigned probabilities so that only the most likely tokens are considered.
Top-k sampling directly limits the maximum number of tokens to consider, while Nucleus sampling limits number of
tokens based on the cumulative probability.
instance_methods.summary: The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling.

instance_methods.name: top_p=
instance_methods.doc:
The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling.
The model uses combined Top-k and nucleus sampling.
Tokens are sorted based on their assigned probabilities so that only the most likely tokens are considered.
Top-k sampling directly limits the maximum number of tokens to consider, while Nucleus sampling limits number of
tokens based on the cumulative probability.
instance_methods.summary: The maximum cumulative probability of tokens to consider when sampling.

types.name: GenerativeModel
types.doc:
Generates a model response given an input.

[API Reference](https://ai.google.dev/api/generate-content#method:-models.generatecontent)
types.summary: Generates a model response given an input.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Configuration parameters are optional and non-initialized, so they must be defined later
constructors.summary: Configuration parameters are optional and non-initialized, so they must be defined later
constructors.args_string: (model_name : String, system_instruction : Gemini::Content | Nil = nil, generation_config : Gemini::GenerationConfig | Nil = nil, safety_settings : Nil | Array(Gemini::SafetySetting) = nil, tools : Nil | Array(Gemini::Tool) = nil, tool_config : Gemini::ToolConfig | Nil = nil, cached_content : Nil | String = nil)
constructors.args_html: (model_name : String, system_instruction : Gemini::Content | Nil = nil, generation_config : Gemini::GenerationConfig | Nil = nil, safety_settings : Nil | Array(Gemini::SafetySetting) = nil, tools : Nil | Array(Gemini::Tool) = nil, tool_config : Gemini::ToolConfig | Nil = nil, cached_content : Nil | String = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(model_name, system_instruction, generation_config, safety_settings, tools, tool_config, cached_content)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: cached_content
instance_methods.doc:
The name of the content [cached](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/caching) to use as context to serve the
prediction. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: The name of the content cached to use as context to serve the prediction.

instance_methods.name: cached_content=
instance_methods.doc:
The name of the content [cached](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/caching) to use as context to serve the
prediction. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: The name of the content cached to use as context to serve the prediction.

instance_methods.name: contents
instance_methods.doc:
The content of the current conversation with the model. *(Required)*
For single-turn queries, this is a single instance. For multi-turn queries  like chat, this is a repeated field
that contains the conversation history and the latest request.
instance_methods.summary: The content of the current conversation with the model.

def.name: contents
def.body:
if (value = @contents).nil?
  ::raise(::NilAssertionError.new("Gemini::GenerativeModel#contents cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

instance_methods.name: contents=
instance_methods.doc:
The content of the current conversation with the model. *(Required)*
For single-turn queries, this is a single instance. For multi-turn queries  like chat, this is a repeated field
that contains the conversation history and the latest request.
instance_methods.summary: The content of the current conversation with the model.

instance_methods.name: contents?
instance_methods.doc:
The content of the current conversation with the model. *(Required)*
For single-turn queries, this is a single instance. For multi-turn queries  like chat, this is a repeated field
that contains the conversation history and the latest request.
instance_methods.summary: The content of the current conversation with the model.

instance_methods.name: generation_config
instance_methods.doc: Configuration options for model generation and outputs. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: Configuration options for model generation and outputs.

instance_methods.name: generation_config=
instance_methods.doc: Configuration options for model generation and outputs. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: Configuration options for model generation and outputs.

instance_methods.name: safety_settings
instance_methods.doc: A list of unique SafetySetting instances for blocking unsafe content. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: A list of unique SafetySetting instances for blocking unsafe content.

instance_methods.name: safety_settings=
instance_methods.doc: A list of unique SafetySetting instances for blocking unsafe content. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: A list of unique SafetySetting instances for blocking unsafe content.

instance_methods.name: system_instruction
instance_methods.doc:
Developer set `system instruction(s)`. Currently, text only. *(Optional)*

[API Reference](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/system-instructions)
instance_methods.summary: Developer set system instruction(s).

instance_methods.name: system_instruction=
instance_methods.doc:
Developer set `system instruction(s)`. Currently, text only. *(Optional)*

[API Reference](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/system-instructions)
instance_methods.summary: Developer set system instruction(s).

instance_methods.name: tool_config
instance_methods.doc:
Tool configuration for any Tool specified in the request. Refer to the Function calling guide for a usage example.
*(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: Tool configuration for any Tool specified in the request.

instance_methods.name: tool_config=
instance_methods.doc:
Tool configuration for any Tool specified in the request. Refer to the Function calling guide for a usage example.
*(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: Tool configuration for any Tool specified in the request.

instance_methods.name: tools
instance_methods.doc: A list of Tools the Model may use to generate the next response. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: A list of Tools the Model may use to generate the next response.

instance_methods.name: tools=
instance_methods.doc: A list of Tools the Model may use to generate the next response. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: A list of Tools the Model may use to generate the next response.

types.name: HarmBlockThreshold
types.doc:
Block at and beyond a specified harm probability.

types.name: Part
types.doc:
A datatype containing media that is part of a multi-part `Content` message.

Union field `data`. `data` can be only one of the following:

* **text**: string - Inline text.
* **inlineData**: object (Blob) - Inline media bytes.
* **functionCall**: object (FunctionCall) - A predicted FunctionCall returned from the model that contains a string
  representing the `FunctionDeclaration#name` with the arguments and their values.
* **functionResponse**: object (FunctionResponse) - The result output of a `FunctionCall` that contains a string
  representing the `FunctionDeclaration#name` and a structured JSON object containing any output from the function
  is used as context to the model.
* **fileData**: object (FileData) - URI based data.
* **executableCode**: object (ExecutableCode) - Code generated by the model that is meant to be executed.
* **codeExecutionResult**: object (CodeExecutionResult) - Result of executing the ExecutableCode.

[API Reference](https://ai.google.dev/api/caching#Part)
types.summary: A datatype containing media that is part of a multi-part Content message.

instance_methods.doc: Same as `#function_call?` but raise error if nil
instance_methods.summary: Same as #function_call? but raise error if nil

instance_methods.name: function_call?
instance_methods.doc: if `#data` type is `FunctionCall` will return value, or nil if not
instance_methods.summary: if #data type is FunctionCall will return value, or nil if not

instance_methods.name: function_call?
instance_methods.doc: Do not yield if `#data` is a diferent type
instance_methods.summary: Do not yield if #data is a diferent type

def.name: function_call?
def.body:
value = function_call?
if value.nil?
  return
end
yield value

instance_methods.name: to_json
instance_methods.doc: Custom JSON serializable
instance_methods.summary: Custom JSON serializable

def.name: to_json
def.body:
json.object do
  if text = text?
    json.field("text", text)
  else
    json.field(data.to_json_object_key) do
      data.to_json(json)
    end
  end
end

types.name: Schema
types.doc:
The Schema object allows the definition of input and output data types. These types can be objects, but also
primitives and arrays. Represents a select subset of an OpenAPI 3.0 schema object.

[API Reference](https://ai.google.dev/api/caching#Schema)
types.summary: The Schema object allows the definition of input and output data types.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (type : Gemini::Schema::Type, format : Nil | String = nil, description : Nil | String = nil, nullable : Bool | Nil = nil, enumeration : Nil | Array(String) = nil, max_items : Nil | String = nil, min_items : Nil | String = nil, properties : Nil | Hash(String, Gemini::Schema) = nil, required : Nil | Array(String) = nil, items : Nil | Gemini::Schema = nil)
constructors.args_html: (type : Gemini::Schema::Type, format : Nil | String = nil, description : Nil | String = nil, nullable : Bool | Nil = nil, enumeration : Nil | Array(String) = nil, max_items : Nil | String = nil, min_items : Nil | String = nil, properties : Nil | Hash(String, Gemini::Schema) = nil, required : Nil | Array(String) = nil, items : Nil | Gemini::Schema = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(type, format, description, nullable, enumeration, max_items, min_items, properties, required, items)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: description
instance_methods.doc:
A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use. Parameter description may be formatted
as Markdown. *(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: A brief description of the parameter.

instance_methods.name: description=
instance_methods.doc:
A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use. Parameter description may be formatted

instance_methods.summary: A brief description of the parameter.

instance_methods.name: enumeration
instance_methods.doc:
Possible values of the element of `Type::String` with enum format. For example we can define an Enum Direction as:

```
Schema.new(
  type: :string,
  format: "enum",
  enumeration: ["EAST", "NORTH", "SOUTH", "WEST"]
)
```
*(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: Possible values of the element of Type::String with enum format.

instance_methods.name: enumeration=

Possible values of the element of `Type::String` with enum format. For example we can define an Enum Direction as:

```
Schema.new(
  type: :string,
  format: "enum",
  enumeration: ["EAST", "NORTH", "SOUTH", "WEST"]
)
```
*(Optional)*
instance_methods.summary: Possible values of the element of Type::String with enum format.

* **NUMBER**: float, double
* **INTEGER**: int32, int64
* **STRING**: enum
